info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:04PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong Cross Winds... Today, strong gusty westerly winds occur along the Rocky Mountain Front. Sustained winds between 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 45 to 55 mph are forecast for this afternoon through early this evening. Travelers, especially on United States Highway 89 between Choteau and the International Boundary and United States Highway 2 between Cut Bank and Marias Pass, should be prepared for strong cross winds. High profile vehicles or those pulling trailers should be especially cautious and know their vehicles limits when traveling this afternoon. Additionally, those recreating in the higher terrain of the Bob Marshall Wilderness and Glacier National Park should be prepared for strong and gusty winds when navigating across ridgelines or near saddles.
